text: Oldbury and Seal Chart is a biological Site of Special Scientific Interest east of Sevenoaks in Kent, England. It is in the Kent Downs Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, and part of it is Oldbury Hill, a National Trust property and Iron Age hill fort. More than 250 species of fungi have been recorded in this site, including 10 which are rare or scarce. There are also molluscs which are characteristic of ancient woodland, including the rare snail Phenacolumax major and the scarce slug Limax tenellus. The site is crossed by several public footpaths. ==References== Category:Sites of Special Scientific Interest in Kent
title: Oldbury and Seal Chart
